div.p: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its simplicity and readability. It is used for web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, and scientific computing.
div.div: Note: Python is dynamically typed, which means you don't need to declare variable types explicitly.
div.p: Here’s an example of a simple Python program:

pre.code: # This is a comment print("Hello, World!")

div.div: Example: The above code will output Hello, World! to the console.
div.p: Variables in Python are created when you assign a value to them. You don't need to declare their type explicitly.

pre.code: x = 5 # An integer y = "Bookphilic" # A string print(x) print(y)
